description.narrative: The project development objective is to increase equitable access to basic education, improve teaching practices, and strengthen MENFOP's management capacity.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education and Vocational Training

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, I.A.1.2The Recipient shall,(a) not later than three (3) month after the Effective Date, install, and thereaftermaintain throughout Project implementation, an accounting software for the Project acceptable to the Association; (b) not laterthan six (6) month after the Effective Date, recruit, and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, an independentexternal auditor with qualifications, experience and terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2, I.A.2.1 The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, establish, and thereaftermaintain at all times during Project implementation, a Project Steering Committee (“PSC”), with a composition, mandate andresources satisfactory to the Association, to provide policy guidance and oversight for the Project.

Schedule 2, I.D.1 Recipient not later than 3 months after the Effective Date, recruit one or more organizations w/ experience,independence, & capacity under TORs acceptable to the Bank (“Independent Verification Agent(s)” or “IVA”) to verify the data andother evidence supporting the achievement of one or more PBC/PBR as set forth in the PBR Verification Protocol and recommendpayment.

Schedule 2, III.B.1.b 1. No withdrawal shall be made: (a) for payments made prior to the Signature Date; (b) under Cat (2) unlessthe verification reports from the IVA, certifying the achievement of the PBC/PBR in accordance with the Verification Protocol aresatisfactory to the Bank & EEP payment have been made in accordance and compliance w/procedure set under the POM.

title.narrative: PDO #4: Learning assessments are revised and administered

target.value: Revised OTIs (years 2 and 5) and at least one national learning assessment are administered
43 canteens in primary and 20 canteens in lower secondary

title.narrative: Percentage of PAs and inspectors conducting classroom observations using an updated tool
Percentage of primary schools that receive detailed reports on results of learning assessments and guidelines for their use to improve teaching and learning
PDO #3: Percentage of basic education teachers demonstrating improved skills, disaggregated by primary and preschool

target.value: 75% of all public primary school and 30% of public preschool teachers demonstrate improved classroom practices.

title.narrative: Percentage of primary and lower secondary school management committees that use participatory processes to assess and improve school performance.
Percentage of school directors who participate in professional community of practice
PDO #1: Additional primary school-level OOSC enrolled, disaggregated by gender and vulnerable populations (girls, refugees, rural students, and special needs students)
Additional public preschool classrooms built or rehabilitated
PDO #2: Gender parity index in lower secondary enrollment (disaggregated by urban/rural) - Gender Results Indicator
Percentage of rural primary and lower secondary schools that have adequate facilities (water point, latrines, electrical or solar power source)
Improved learning outcomes for year 2 students

target.value: To be determined when baseline is calculated, once assessment is carried out

title.narrative: Sub-regional plans to promote enrollment and reduce dropout are approved

target.value: Adapted interventions in all five regions are implemented

title.narrative: Number of preschool teachers trained on the new curriculum (CRI)

target.value: 70% of public and 50% of private primary schools transmit their data via the application on time.
At least 3 competency frameworks for teachers, school leaders, pedagogical advisors officially approved by MENFOP.
At least 30 percent of public and private preschools meeting quality standards (as measured by quality audit)

title.narrative: Administration of a digital evaluation of digital literacy skills

target.value: Development of an action plan based on the results of the evaluation.

title.narrative: Reinforcing the use of ICT for learning

target.value: Percentage of year 4 students who used an ICT tool for learning

title.narrative: Assessment levels in math and at least one language are officially approved in primary and lower secondary education

target.value: Primary and lower secondary assessment levels in math and at least one language are officially approved.

title.narrative: Administration of a revised Brevet (9th year national assessment)

target.value: Yes; administration of a revised Brevet

title.narrative: Percentage of trainers trained in the analysis of practical teaching methods
Number of teachers trained in the use of distance learning methods (disaggregated by sex, level of education, geographic zone)
Number of exam copies produced by the Department of Exams (DEC)
Percentage of inspectors and Pedagogical Advisors evaluated
Percentage of school management committees trained and capable of supporting parents to support their children's learning by remotemethods
The grade level of classes in primary and lower secondary education with a revised curriculum

target.value: Revised curriculum rolled out to Grades 1-9
